Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2014 04:50PM Mommyofboys4 wrote: Thank you ladies for the nice replies. I have been trying not to think about it to much I figure worrying about it isn't going to change the outcome. I think I'm overly sensitive about cancer simply because of the various cancers that my family has had and losing my father to cancer at a very young age. But I know the odds are in my favor and I need to just remain positive. I will just be glad when the whole testing process is over and I have a definitive answer. Until then I will just continue with my life the same as always. With my boys.
Posts.Title: Waiting Mommyofboys4 abbeyesque

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2014 12:17PM Mommyofboys4 wrote: Had my mammogram today. And another ultrasound. Mammogram was BI-RAD 4 so doctor did biopsy. Now I just wait and see. Hopefully I will hear something by Friday and won't have to wait over the weekend. Trying not to worry about it to much. I know the odds are still good at it being benign.
